page.title: 09Historic Buildings
page.content: In our study area there is a house called Balsams. Balsam is a medicinal herb and was grown along with other herbs in the fields owned by The Knights Hospitallers of St.John.This group were Crusader Knights who fought in The Holy Land. Their sign was a Maltese cross, which today is used by the St.John's Ambulance Brigade. The commander of the Order of the Knights Hospitallers lived where Standon Friars is now. On one of our walks around the village in late June and July we noticed wild balsam growing in abundance on Oudle Lane.We took some of the flowers back to school to examine them more closely.It belongs to the genus of plants Impatiens and has hooded and spurred coloured sepals and thick succulent stems.
